options.name: server
options.description: This includes configurations required for configuring the deployment parameters that are used for identifying the Choreo Connect Adapter REST APIs.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Enable/Disable Choreo Connect Adapter REST API.

params.name: host
params.description: Hostname of the Choreo Connect Adapter.

params.name: port
params.description: Port of the Choreo Connect Adapter.

params.name: tokenTTL
params.description: Time to live for the Adapter access token.

params.name: tokenPrivateKeyPath
params.description: Private key path to use for the token generation.

options.name: keystore
options.description: The configurations of key store used in Choreo Connect Adapter.

params.name: certPath
params.description: Path of the certificate of the Adapter.

params.name: keyPath
params.description: Path of the private key of the Adapter.

options.name: truststore
options.description: The configurations of trust store used in the Choreo Connect Adapter.

params.name: location
params.description: The directory path for the trusted certificates of the Choreo Connect Adapter.

params.name: vhost
params.description: Virtual host to map to the environment.

params.name: url
params.description: Connection url of the Consul HTTP API.

params.name: pollInterval
params.description: The time interval (in seconds) in which the Choreo Connect should fetch updates from the Consul service catalog.

params.name: aclToken
params.description: Access Control Token generated using Consul. You should grant read access to services when creating the token.

params.name: mgwServiceName
params.description: Choreo Connect natively integrates with Consul service mesh. Therefore a service name is required to be defined inorder to grant access to other services in mesh. This only need to be defined if service mesh enabled in Consul.

params.name: serviceMeshEnabled
params.description: Set this to true if service mesh is enabled in Consul

params.name: caCertFile
params.description: This is the optional path to the CA certificate used for Consul communication, defaults to the system bundle if not specified.

params.name: certFile
params.description: This is the optional path to the certificate for Consul communication. If this is set, then you also need to set keyFile.

params.name: keyFile
params.description: This is the optional path to the private key for Consul communication. If this is set, then you need to also set certFile.
